about_the_game:
Do you remember how, as a child, you used to holiday with your parents, traveling in an old camper? It's still in the garage, wasting away. The the neighborhood kids used it to paint graffiti on it; it is eaten by rust, and the furnishings and equipment are just scrap at this point. Renovate it, equip it and go on holiday to a selected location! Have adventures at the campsite - although it may not be an idyll, with a troublemaker son and a grumpy wife. If, at the end of your holiday, you find a buyer for your camper - sell it, and use the money to buy another, larger camper. And since you've done so well and had a great time to boot, expand the business of renovating campers to earn money and organize your next holiday in new places.

Get rid of graffiti and rust, repair the most important elements, weld, cut sheet metal, tighten, invest in new parts. Make your camper look exceptional.

There's also a lot of work to be done inside. Remove everything that is damaged and unnecessary and install the necessary equipment in a practical way. Comfort is the most important, so research the necessary amenities carefully.

When the camper is ready, select the destination out of many possible options, inspired by the real locations along the legendary Route 66. Meet new, sometimes crazy friends. Deal with surprising, unusual situations. Beware of changing weather conditions and, above all, the shenanigans of your troublemaker son and his new colleagues. Present your motorhome to other tourists, so that, at the end of the summer, you can earn money for selling your camper.

Use the money you have earned to bid on a range of new caravan wrecks. Invest in repairs, renovations and adequate equipment to prepare the vehicle as expected by future buyers, specific to the selected region of the US. If you do not over-invest, you should have a lot of cash left, which you can allocate for the development of your office, workshop and for subsequent campers.

Each camper has a history behind it and offers new challenges, but also adventures on subsequent campsites. Don't be surprised by what you'll find in the renovated campers. The junk lef inside might not only prove useful, but might also allow you to learn the habits of the previous owner. Additionally, it may turn out to be an unexpected problem to solve or the beginning of something new - and possibly good.

One is never lonely living in a camper. During your camping trips you will meet many new and well-known people. Sometimes you might get the impression that some of them are stalking you, because they always pop up wherever you go with a new camper for sale. Some may simply be mean. Others may surprise you. Camper camping adventures maybe a greater challenge than renovations of old campings.

name: American Camper Simulator

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Microsoft Windows 7/8/10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 3,20GHz / AMD Phenom II X4 955 3,2 GHz
  • Memory: 4 MB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 970 / AMD Radeon RX
  • Sound Card: DirectX compatible
  • Additional Notes: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Refurbish an old camper. Give it a spin on a selected stretch along the Route 66. Show off your camper to other tourists during your camping holiday, to sell it at a profit. Expand the business and earn money; have crazy and sometimes dangerous adventures in the USA in your subsequent camper.
supported_languages:
English*, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Polish, Portuguese - Portugal, Russian, Simplified Chinese, Turkish
*languages with full audio support
